intro: Sloanea alnifolia var. ovalis, commonly known as the oval-leaf sloanea, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its lanceolate to elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
